intro: Lotus mearnsii var. equisolensis, commonly known as the Evergreen lotus, is a variant of the Mearns' lotus. It is a perennial shrub native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plant features compound leaves with serrated margins and produces small, pinkish-white flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or arid environments. The botanical characteristics of this variety include its evergreen foliage and its ability to withstand drought conditions.
